thread.title: Competition terms and conditions: Goodwood Revival
thread.title_full: Competition terms and conditions: Goodwood Revival - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Competition terms and conditions: Goodwood Revival
text: 1. This prize draw is open to residents of the UK, Channel Islands, Isle of Man and Republic of Ireland aged 18 years or over, except employees of Telegraph Media Group Limited and its group companies (“Promoter”), and Michelin Tyre Plc, their families, agents or anyone else professionally associated with the draw. 2. Details of how to enter form part of the terms and conditions. It is a condition of entry that all rules are accepted as final and that the competitor agrees to abide by these rules. The decision of the judges is final and no correspondence will be entered into. 3. To enter this competition, participants must enter by submitting their answer to a question correctly which will feature on www.telegraph.co.uk/performancedriving. The question will relate to a video based on the Goodwood Festival of Speed 2015 and will feature on www.telegraph.co.uk/performancedriving. Once submitted, the Promoter cannot accept any amends to any part of an entry. 4. Late, illegible, incomplete, defaced or corrupt entries or entries sent through agencies and third parties will not be accepted. No responsibility can be accepted for lost entries and proof of despatch will not be accepted as proof of receipt. The winner will be drawn at random from all entries received by the closing date. The winner’s name and county can be obtained by sending a sae to Goodwood Revival with Michelin Winner, Spark, Telegraph Media Group, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT within one month after the closing date of the prize draw. 5. All entries must be received by 23.59pm on 30 August 2015. 6. The winner will be contacted by close of play on Tuesday 1 September 2015. Should the Promoter be unable to contact the winner or should the winner be unable to accept the prize, the Promoter reserves the right to award the prize to an alternative winner, drawn in accordance with these terms and conditions. 7. The prize as described is available on the date of publication. Should the prize become unavailable, a substitute of equal value shall be provided. 8. The winning entrant will win The Goodwood Revival with Michelin Prize Package. The prize package comprises: • A pair of entry tickets for Sunday 13 September2015 to the Goodwood Revival. • Overnight accommodation for the night before entrance to Goodwood Revival on Saturday 12 September at The Old Thorns 4 Star Hotel, Liphook, Hampshire, GU30 7PE. This will include breakfast on Sunday 13 September 2015. • Return coach transfer from the accommodation to Goodwood Revival on Sunday 13 September 2015. The winner will need to organise their own transport home from the event on Sunday 13 September 2015. • A picnic box including wine for two people, for the event. 9. The prize must be taken as one package. 10. The prize does not include: transport from the winner’s home to the accommodation; transport from the event to the winner’s home; or personal expenditure. 11. All elements of the prize are subject to availability, non transferable and there are no cash alternatives. 12. The winner may be required to participate in reasonable publicity on behalf of the Promoter and Michelin Tyre Plc. 13. Entrants’ data will be used for the purpose of administration of this prize draw and in accordance with the permissions granted or withheld at the point of entry. 14. Events may occur that render the prize draw itself or the awarding of the prize impossible due to reasons beyond the control of the Promoter and accordingly the Promoter may at its absolute discretion vary or amend the promotion and the entrant agrees that no liability shall attach to the Promoter as a result thereof. 15. The Telegraph is responsible for the first part of the promotion, which is the publication and adjudication of the prize draw. Provision of the prize is the responsibility of Michelin Tyre Plc. 16. These Terms and Conditions are to be interpreted in accordance with English law and any dispute arising out of these Terms or their subject matter is subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts. Promoter: Telegraph Media Group Limited, 111 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 0DT. Online Form - Competition terms and conditions: Goodwood Revival
